title: tmap: JSS article reproduction code
text: article Tennekes, M. tmap: Thematic Maps R (2018), Journal Statistical Software 84(6), 1-39, http://dx.doi.org/10.18637/jss.v084.i06 describes version 1.x tmap tmaptools. Since tmap tmaptools version 2.0 based sf objects instead sp objects, changes code, especially regarding necessary processing step. code plotting methods fully backward compatible, although messages warnings may given deprecated functions arguments. code replaces script v84i06.R tmap tmaptools version 2.0. produced figures identical included article. See vignette("tmap-changes") changes version 2.x/3.x, recommended people read JSS article. people new tmap, see vignette("tmap-getstarted").
code: ########################################################################### ## This script will replicate the figures (except the screenshots) ## and write them to files. ## The working directory should be set the the parent folder of this script. ###########################################################################  ## install.packages(c("tmap", "tmaptools")) library("tmap") # required version 2.0 or later library("tmaptools") # required version 2.0 or later  data("World", "metro", package = "tmap") metro$growth <- (metro$pop2020 - metro$pop2010) / (metro$pop2010 * 10) * 100

title: tmap: JSS article reproduction code
code: ############################# ## Figure 1 #############################  m1 <- tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("income_grp", palette = "-Blues",        title = "Income class", contrast = 0.7, border.col = "grey30", id = "name") +     tm_text("iso_a3", size = "AREA", col = "grey30", root = 3) +   tm_shape(metro) +     tm_bubbles("pop2010", col = "growth", border.col = "black",       border.alpha = 0.5,       breaks = c(-Inf, 0, 2, 4, 6, Inf) ,       palette = "-RdYlGn",       title.size = "Metro population (2010)",        title.col = "Annual growth rate (%)",       id = "name",       popup.vars = c("pop2010", "pop2020", "growth")) +    tm_style("gray") +   tm_format("World", frame.lwd = 2) tmap_save(m1, "bubble.png", width = 6.125, height = 3, scale = .75, dpi = 300, asp = 0, outer.margins = 0)

code: ############################# ## Figure 7 ############################# data("land", "rivers", package = "tmap") m2 <- tm_shape(land) +   tm_raster("elevation", breaks = c(-Inf, 250, 500, 1000, 1500, 2000, 2500, 3000, 4000, Inf),               palette = terrain.colors(9), title = "Elevation (m)") +   tm_shape(rivers) +    tm_lines("lightblue", lwd = "strokelwd", scale = 1.5, legend.lwd.show = FALSE) +   tm_shape(World, is.master = TRUE) +   tm_borders("grey20", lwd = .5) +   tm_grid(projection = "longlat", labels.size = 0.4, lwd = 0.25) +   tm_text("name", size = "AREA") +   tm_compass(position = c(0.08, 0.45), color.light = "grey90", size = 3) +   tm_credits("Eckert IV projection", position = c("RIGHT", "BOTTOM")) +   tm_style("classic",          bg.color = "lightblue",          space.color = "grey90",          inner.margins = c(0.04, 0.04, 0.03, 0.02),           earth.boundary = TRUE) +   tm_legend(position = c("left", "bottom"),              frame = TRUE,             bg.color = "lightblue") tmap_save(m2, "classic.png", width = 6.125, scale = .7, dpi = 300, outer.margins = 0)

code: ############################# ## Figure 9 ############################# library("readxl") library("grid")  # function to obtain Food Environment Atlas data (2014) get_food_envir_data <- function() {   dir <- tempdir()   if (!file.exists(file.path(dir, "DataDownload.xls"))) {     download.file("https://www.ers.usda.gov/webdocs/DataFiles/48731/February2014.xls?v=41688", destfile = file.path(dir, "DataDownload.xls"), mode = "wb")   }   res <- tryCatch({     read_excel(file.path(dir, "DataDownload.xls"), sheet = "HEALTH")       }, error = function(e) {     stop("The excel file cannot be read. Please open it, and remove all sheets except HEALTH. The location of the file is: ", normalizePath(file.path(dir, "DataDownload.xls")))   }) }  # function to obtain US county shape get_US_county_2010_shape <- function() {   dir <- tempdir()   download.file("http://www2.census.gov/geo/tiger/GENZ2010/gz_2010_us_050_00_20m.zip", destfile = file.path(dir, "gz_2010_us_050_00_20m.zip"))   unzip(file.path(dir, "gz_2010_us_050_00_20m.zip"), exdir = dir)   US <- sf::read_sf(file.path(dir, "gz_2010_us_050_00_20m.shp"))   levels(US$NAME) <- iconv(levels(US$NAME), from = "latin1", to = "utf8")   US }  # obtain Food Environment Atlas data FEA <- get_food_envir_data()  # obtain US county shape US <- get_US_county_2010_shape()  us1 <- qtm(US)  tmap_save(us1, "US1.png", scale = .5, width = 6.125, asp = 0, outer.margins = 0)  ############################# ## Figure 10 ############################# library(dplyr) library(sf)  US$FIPS <- paste0(US$STATE, US$COUNTY)  # append data to shape #US <- append_data(US, FEA, key.shp = "FIPS", key.data = "FIPS", ignore.duplicates = TRUE) US <- left_join(US, FEA, by = c("FIPS", "FIPS"))   unmatched_data <- FEA %>% filter(!(FIPS %in% US$FIPS))  tmap_mode("view") qtm(US, fill = "PCT_OBESE_ADULTS10") ############################# ## Figure 11 ############################# US_cont <- US %>%    subset(!STATE %in% c("02", "15", "72")) %>%    simplify_shape(0.2)   US_AK <- US %>%    subset(STATE == "02") %>%    simplify_shape(0.2)   US_HI <- US %>%    subset(STATE == "15") %>%    simplify_shape(0.2)   # create state boundaries US_states <- US_cont %>%      dplyr::select(geometry) %>%      aggregate(by = list(US_cont$STATE), FUN = mean)   # contiguous US m_cont <- tm_shape(US_cont, projection = 2163) +   tm_polygons("PCT_OBESE_ADULTS10", border.col = "gray50", border.alpha = .5, title = "", showNA = TRUE) +   tm_shape(US_states) +   tm_borders(lwd = 1, col = "black", alpha = .5) +   tm_credits("Data @ Unites States Department of Agriculture\nShape @ Unites States Census Bureau", position = c("right", "bottom")) +   tm_layout(title = "2010 Adult Obesity by County, percent",              title.position = c("center", "top"),              legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),              frame = FALSE,              inner.margins = c(0.1, 0.1, 0.05, 0.05))  # Alaska inset m_AK <- tm_shape(US_AK, projection = 3338) +   tm_polygons("PCT_OBESE_ADULTS10", border.col = "gray50", border.alpha = .5, breaks = seq(10, 50, by = 5)) +   tm_layout("Alaska", legend.show = FALSE, bg.color = NA, title.size = 0.8, frame = FALSE)  # Hawaii inset m_HI <- tm_shape(US_HI, projection = 3759) +   tm_polygons("PCT_OBESE_ADULTS10", border.col = "gray50", border.alpha = .5, breaks = seq(10, 50, by = 5)) +   tm_layout("Hawaii", legend.show = FALSE, bg.color = NA, title.position = c("LEFT", "BOTTOM"), title.size = 0.8, frame = FALSE)  # specify viewports for Alaska and Hawaii vp_AK <- viewport(x = 0.15, y = 0.15, width = 0.3, height = 0.3) vp_HI <- viewport(x = 0.4, y = 0.1, width = 0.2, height = 0.1)  # save map tmap_mode("plot") tmap_save(m_cont, "USchoro.png", scale = 0.7, width = 6.125, outer.margins = 0,           insets_tm = list(m_AK, m_HI),            insets_vp = list(vp_AK, vp_HI))

title: tmap: JSS article reproduction code
code: ############################# ## Figure 12a ############################# library("sf") library("rnaturalearth")  # functions to obtain crimes data get_crimes_data <- function(path) {   stopifnot(file.exists(path), ("crimes_in_Greater_London_2015-10.zip" %in% list.files(path)))   tmp_dir <- tempdir()   unzip(file.path(path, "crimes_in_Greater_London_2015-10.zip"), exdir = tmp_dir)   rbind(read.csv(file.path(tmp_dir, "2015-10-city-of-london-street.csv")),         read.csv(file.path(tmp_dir, "2015-10-metropolitan-street.csv"))) }  # please download the file "crimes_in_Greater_London_2015-10.zip" (available on https://www.jstatsoft.org as a supplement of this paper), and change the path argument below to the location of the downloaded file: crimes <- get_crimes_data(path = "./")  # create sf of known locations crimes <- crimes[!is.na(crimes$Longitude) & !is.na(crimes$Latitude), ] crimes <- st_as_sf(crimes, coords = c("Longitude", "Latitude"), crs = 4326)  # set map projection to British National Grid crimes <- st_transform(crimes, crs = 27700)  c1 <- qtm(crimes) tmap_save(c1, "crimes1.png", scale = .6, width = 3, units = "in", outer.margins = 0) ############################# ## Figure 12b ############################# crimes_osm <- read_osm(crimes) c2 <- qtm(crimes_osm) + qtm(crimes, symbols.col = "red", symbols.size = 0.5) tmap_save(c2, "crimes2.jpg", scale = .6, width = 3, units = "in", outer.margins = 0) ############################# ## Figure 13 ############################# c3 <- qtm(crimes_osm, raster.saturation = 0, raster.alpha = 1) +    qtm(crimes, symbols.col = "Crime.type", symbols.size = 0.5) +   tm_legend(outside = TRUE) tmap_save(c3, "crimes3.png", scale = .8, width = 5, height = 4, units = "in", outer.margins = 0) ############################# ## Figure 14 ############################# regions <- ne_download(scale = "large", type = "states", category = "cultural", returnclass = "sf") london <- regions[which(regions$region == "Greater London"),] london <- st_transform(london, crs = 27700)  # remove crimes outside Greater London crimes_london <- crop_shape(crimes, london, polygon =  TRUE)  c3b <- qtm(crimes_london, dots.alpha = 0.1) +   tm_shape(london) +    tm_borders() tmap_save(c3b, "crimes3b.png", scale = .7, width = 6.125, units = "in", outer.margins = 0) ############################# ## Figure 15 ############################# library("devtools") install_github("mtennekes/oldtmaptools") library(oldtmaptools)  crime_densities <- smooth_map(crimes_london, bandwidth = 0.5, breaks = c(0, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000), cover = london)  # download rivers, and get Thames shape rivers <- ne_download(scale = "large", type = "rivers_lake_centerlines", category = "physical") thames <- crop_shape(rivers, london)  c4 <- tm_shape(crime_densities$polygons) +   tm_fill(col = "level", palette = "YlOrRd", title = expression("Crimes per " * km^2)) +    tm_shape(london) + tm_borders() +   tm_shape(thames) + tm_lines(col = "steelblue", lwd = 4) +   tm_compass(position = c("left", "bottom")) +   tm_scale_bar(position = c("left", "bottom")) +    tm_style("gray", title = "Crimes in Greater London\nOctober 2015") tmap_save(c4, "crimes4.png", scale = .7, width = 6.125, units = "in", outer.margins = 0) ############################# ## Figure 16 ############################# london_city <- london[london$name == "City",] crimes_city <- crop_shape(crimes_london, london_city, polygon = TRUE) london_osm <- read_osm(london_city, type = "stamen-watercolor", zoom = 13)  c5 <- qtm(london_osm) +   tm_shape(crimes_city) +   tm_dots(size = .2) +   tm_facets("Crime.type", free.coords = FALSE) tmap_save(c5, "crimes5.png", scale = 1, width = 6.125, asp = NA, outer.margins = 0) ############################# ## Figure 17 ############################# crime_lookup <- c("Anti-social behaviour" = 2,                    "Bicycle theft" = 1,                    "Burglary" = 1,                   "Criminal damage and arson" = 2,                   "Drugs" = 6,                    "Other crime" = 7,                   "Other theft" = 1,                    "Possession of weapons" = 3,                    "Public order" = 2,                    "Robbery" = 1,                    "Shoplifting" = 1,                   "Theft from the person" = 1,                   "Vehicle crime" = 4,                   "Violence and sexual offences" = 5) crime_categories <- c("Property Crime",                       "Criminal damage and anti-social behaviour",                       "Possession of weapons",                       "Vehicle crime",                       "Violence and sexual offences",                       "Drugs",                       "Other crime") crimes_city$Crime.group <- factor(crime_lookup[crimes_city$Crime.type], labels = crime_categories)  tmap_mode("view") tm_shape(crimes_city) +   tm_dots(jitter = 0.2, col = "Crime.group", palette = "Dark2", popup.vars = TRUE) +   tm_view(alpha = 1,     basemaps = "Esri.WorldTopoMap")

title: tmap: version changes
text: version 2.0, tmap functions prefix tm_ tmap_, exception function qtm. Just like tmap version 1.x, layer functions start tm_. tmap 1.x, names functions inconsistent, e.g. animation_tmap tmap_arrange. tmap 2.x/3.x, functions prefixed tmap_. instance animation_tmap renamed tmap_animation.

title: tmap: version changes
text: tmap 1.x uses sp representing vector data, raster raster data. tmap 2.x uses sf representing vector data, raster raster data. tmap 3.x uses sf representing vector data, stars raster data. sf (simple features) objects simpler structure sp objects. sf object nothing data.frame special geometry column contains geometries corresponding rows. geometry can type spatial point(s), line(s) polygon(s) combination ‘geometrycollection’ (see vignette("sf1")). layers functions, tm_polygons, draw supposed draw (case polygons). newly added layer function tm_sf draw geometries. Finally, data objects tmap (except land) transformed sf objects. object land transformed stars object.

title: tmap: version changes
text: Layer functions added facilitate tile layers. version 1.x, already possible add basemaps. version 2.0, facilitated explicit layer functions tm_basemap tm_tiles. former creates basemap tile latter overlay tile. difference tm_basemap layers always drawn bottom, whereas plotting order (overlay) tm_tiles layers derived plot call. Overlay layers semi-transparent useful. Tip: tilemaps https://leaflet-extras.github.io/leaflet-providers/preview/ can used. names maps can also found list object leaflet::providers.
code: data(World, metro) tmap_mode("view")  tm_basemap(leaflet::providers$CartoDB.PositronNoLabels, group = "CartoDB basemap") + tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI", group = "Countries") + tm_tiles(leaflet::providers$CartoDB.PositronOnlyLabels, group = "CartoDB labels") + tm_shape(metro) +     tm_dots(col = "red", group = "Metropolitan areas")

title: tmap: version changes
text: many options tmap. version 1.x, default values stored tm_layout tm_view. Wrapper functions like tm_style_gray tm_format_World used change options. version 2.0, options stored similar fashion global options. list tmap options can retrieved options can set function tmap_options. behavior similar base function options. style configuration options used style map specific way. set tmap_style, current options overwritten according new style. changes can seen tmap_options_diff can reset tmap_options_reset.   Styles included tmap : "white", "gray", "natural", "cobalt", "col_blind", "albatross", "beaver", "bw", "classic". New styles can saved loaded tmap_style_save tmap_style_load respectively. version 1.x, tmap contained couple predefined format functions, tm_format_World. version 2.0, replaced general function tm_format. function, available formats can retrieved, well configuration specific format. function tm_format_add new formats can created. Unlike style, format set globally. Instead, specified plot:
code: data(World) qtm(World, fill = "life_exp") tmap_style("classic") ## tmap style set to "classic" ## other available styles are: "white", "gray", "natural", "cobalt", "col_blind", "albatross", "beaver", "bw", "watercolor"  qtm(World, fill = "life_exp") tmap_options_diff() ## current tmap options (style "classic") that are different from default tmap options (style "white"): ## $sepia.intensity ## [1] 0.7 ##  ## $frame.double.line ## [1] TRUE ##  ## $fontfamily ## [1] "serif" ##  ## $compass.type ## [1] "rose" ##  ## $basemaps ## [1] "Esri.WorldTopoMap" ##  ## $basemaps.alpha ## [1] 0.5  tmap_options_reset() ## tmap options successfully reset tmap_format() ## available formats are: "World", "World_wide", "NLD", "NLD_wide" panorama <- tmap_format("World") panorama$asp <- 6 tmap_format_add(panorama, name = "panorama") ## format panorama succesfully added. Use this format with tm_format("panorama") tmap_format() ## available formats are: "World", "World_wide", "NLD", "NLD_wide", "panorama" tm_shape(World) + tm_polygons("HPI") + tm_format("panorama") # or: qtm(World, fill = "HPI", format = "panorama")

title: tmap: version changes
text: Viridis palettes (viridis/viridisLite package) supported natively. E.g. qtm(World, "HPI", fill.palette = "-plasma"). Notice , like color brewer palette names, minus sign reverse palette. See tmaptools::palette_explorer() explore color brewer viridis palettes interactively. arguments define color palette mapping made intuitive. newly added layer function arguments midpoint stretch.palette replace auto.palette.mapping: Categorical palettes. argument stretch.palette determines whether palette stretched categories available colors. set FALSE, palette repeated. Diverging palettes. argument midpoint determines value mapped middle (neutral) color diverging color palette. default, set 0 positive negative values. mean part color palette used, e.g. value range [-5, 20] palette "RdBu", colors range light red (-5) white (0) dark blue (20). positive negative values, full palette shown. Sequential palettes. Nothing changed sequential palettes. midpoint specified, palette regarded diverging palette, middle color interpreted neutral color.

what: filter, difference between NA and NULL
title: tmap: version changes
text: argument filter added tm_shape. Features included visualized usual. Excluded features still visualized without color mapped. Instead, colored colorNULL, new argument layer functions. Note difference colorNA, used color features missing data. show potiential filter following code chunk creates map European countries colored:  Countries outside Europe colored colorNULL, grey95 default. can adjusted layer functions, tm_polygons, tmap_options. also missing values data (Kosovo Moldova) colored colorNA (default grey85).
code: tm_shape(World, filter = World$continent=="Europe") +     tm_polygons("HPI", id = "name")

title: tmap: get started!
text: good place start create map world. installing tmap, following lines code create map shown :  object World spatial object class sf sf package; data.frame special column contains geometry row, case polygons. order plot tmap, first need specify tm_shape. Layers can added + operator, case tm_polygons. many layer functions tmap, can easily found documentation tm_ prefix. See also ?'tmap-element'.
code: library(tmap) ## Breaking News: tmap 3.x is retiring. Please test v4, e.g. with ## remotes::install_github('r-tmap/tmap') data("World")  tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI")

title: tmap: get started!
text: map can plotted static image viewed interactively using "plot" "view" modes, respectively. mode can set function tmap_mode, toggling modes can done ‘switch’ ttm() (stands toggle thematic map.
code: tmap_mode("view")  tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI")

title: tmap: get started!
text: shape spatial object (class sf, sp, stars, raster). Multiple shapes also multiple layers per shape can plotted:
code: data(World, metro, rivers, land)  tmap_mode("plot") ## tmap mode set to plotting tm_shape(land) +     tm_raster("elevation", palette = terrain.colors(10)) + tm_shape(World) +     tm_borders("white", lwd = .5) +     tm_text("iso_a3", size = "AREA") + tm_shape(metro) +     tm_symbols(col = "red", size = "pop2020", scale = .5) + tm_legend(show = FALSE) ## old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() ## old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() ## old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs()

title: tmap: get started!
text: Tiled basemaps can added layer function tm_basemap. Semi-transparent overlay maps (example annotation labels) can added tm_tiles.  See preview available tilemaps. list also accessible R: leaflet::providers.
code: tmap_mode("view") tm_basemap("Stamen.Watercolor") + tm_shape(metro) + tm_bubbles(size = "pop2020", col = "red") + tm_tiles("Stamen.TonerLabels")

title: tmap: get started!
text: functions tm_layout tm_view used specify map layout interactive aspects respectively. functions can used way layer functions, e.g.  options, well couple others, can also set within tmap_options, works way base R function options. main advantage options set globally, specified map, duration session.  style certain configuration tmap options.  New styles can created; see ?tmap_options.
code: tmap_mode("plot") ## tmap mode set to plotting  tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI") + tm_layout(bg.color = "skyblue", inner.margins = c(0, .02, .02, .02)) tmap_options(bg.color = "black", legend.text.color = "white")  tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI", legend.title = "Happy Planet Index") tmap_style("classic") ## tmap style set to "classic" ## other available styles are: "white", "gray", "natural", "cobalt", "col_blind", "albatross", "beaver", "bw", "watercolor"  tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI", legend.title = "Happy Planet Index") # see what options have been changed tmap_options_diff() ## current tmap options (style "classic") that are different from default tmap options (style "white"): ## $sepia.intensity ## [1] 0.7 ##  ## $frame.double.line ## [1] TRUE ##  ## $fontfamily ## [1] "serif" ##  ## $compass.type ## [1] "rose" ##  ## $basemaps ## [1] "Esri.WorldTopoMap" ##  ## $basemaps.alpha ## [1] 0.5  # reset the options to the default values tmap_options_reset() ## tmap options successfully reset

title: tmap: get started!
code: tm <- tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("HPI", legend.title = "Happy Planet Index")  ## save an image ("plot" mode) tmap_save(tm, filename = "world_map.png")  ## save as stand-alone HTML file ("view" mode) tmap_save(tm, filename = "world_map.html")

code: qtm(   shp,   fill = NA,   symbols.size = NULL,   symbols.col = NULL,   symbols.shape = NULL,   dots.col = NULL,   text = NULL,   text.size = 1,   text.col = NA,   lines.lwd = NULL,   lines.col = NULL,   raster = NA,   borders = NA,   by = NULL,   scale = NA,   title = NA,   projection = NULL,   bbox = NULL,   basemaps = NA,   overlays = NA,   style = NULL,   format = NULL,   ... )

title: Quick thematic map plot — qtm
text: shp One shape object, object class defined sf stars package. Objects packages sp raster also supported, discouraged. specified, .e. qtm() executed. case plain interactive map shown. OSM search string, e.g. qtm("Amsterdam"). case plain interactive map shown positioned according results search query (OpenStreetMap nominatim) fill either color fill polygons, name data variable shp draw choropleth. applicable shp contains polygons.  Set fill = NULL draw polygon borders. See also argument borders. symbols.size either size symbols name data variable shp specifies sizes symbols.  See also size argument tm_symbols. applicable shp contains spatial points, lines, polygons. symbols.col either color symbols name data variable shp specifies colors symbols. See also col arugment tm_symbols. applicable shp contains spatial points, lines, polygons. symbols.shape either shape symbols name data variable shp specifies shapes symbols. See also shape arugment tm_symbols. applicable shp contains spatial points, lines, polygons. dots.col name data variable shp dot map specifies colors dots. dots.col specified instead symbols.col, dots instead bubbles drawn (unless symbols.shape specified). text Name data variable contains text labels. applicable shp contains spatial points, lines, polygons. text.size Font size text labels. Either constant value, name numeric data variable. applicable shp contains spatial points, lines, polygons. text.col name data variable shp specifies colors text labels. applicable shp contains spatial points, lines, polygons. lines.lwd either line width name data variable specifies line width. applicable shp contains spatial lines. lines.col either line color name data variable specifies line colors. applicable shp contains spatial lines. raster either color name data variable specifices raster colors. applicable shp spatial raster. borders color polygon borders. Use NULL omit borders. data variable name data split, vector two variable names split data two variables (first used rows second columns). See also tm_facets scale numeric value serves global scale parameter. font sizes, symbol sizes, border widths, line widths controlled value. parameters symbols.size, text.size, lines.lwd can scaled seperately respectively symbols.scale, text.scale, lines.scale. See also .... title main title. legend titles, use X.style, X layer name (see ...). projection Either crs object character value (PROJ.4 character string). default, projection used defined shp object . bbox bounding box. Arugment passed tm_shape basemaps name(s) provider URL tiled basemap. shortcut tm_basemap. Set NULL disable basemaps. default, set tmap option basemaps. overlays name(s) provider URL tiled overlay map. shortcut tm_tiles. style Layout options (see tm_layout) define style. See tmap_style details. format Layout options (see tm_layout) define format. See tmap_format details. ... arguments passed tm_* functions. prefix arguments layer function name without "tm_" period. instance, palette polygon fill color called fill.palette. following prefixes supported: shape., fill., borders., polygons., symbols., dots., lines., raster., text., layout., grid., facets., view.. Arguments unique name, .e. exist layer function, e.g. convert2density, can also called without prefix.

See examples. default, scale bar shown. option can set tmap_options (argument qtm.scalebar). minimap shown default qtm called without arguments search term. option can set tmap_options (argument qtm.minimap).

title: Quick thematic map plot — qtm
text: Tennekes, M., 2018, tmap: Thematic Maps R, Journal Statistical Software, 84(6), 1-39, doi:10.18637/jss.v084.i06

title: Quick thematic map plot — qtm
code: data(World, rivers, metro)  # just the map qtm(World)   # choropleth qtm(World, fill = "economy", format = "World", style = "col_blind", projection = "+proj=eck4")   # choropleth with more specifications qtm(World, fill="HPI", fill.n = 9, fill.palette = "div",     fill.title = "Happy Planet Index", fill.id = "name",      style = "gray", format = "World", projection = "+proj=eck4")  # this map can also be created with the main plotting method, # which is recommended in this case. if (FALSE) { tm_shape(World, projection = "+proj=eck4") +     tm_polygons("HPI", n = 9, palette = "div",         title = "Happy Planet Index", id = "name") + tm_style("gray") + tm_format("World") }  # bubble map if (FALSE) { qtm(World, borders = NULL) +  qtm(metro, symbols.size = "pop2010",      symbols.title.size= "Metropolitan Areas",      symbols.id= "name",     format = "World") }  # dot map if (FALSE) { current.mode <- tmap_mode("view") qtm(metro, bbox = "China") tmap_mode(current.mode) # restore mode }  if (FALSE) { # without arguments, a plain interactive map is shown (the mode is set to view) qtm()  # search query for OpenStreetMap nominatim qtm("Amsterdam") }

title: Wrapper functions for using tmap in shiny — renderTmap
text: Use tmapOutput create UI element, renderTmap render tmap map. update map (specifically, add remove layers) use tmapProxy. Adding layers usual, removing layers can done function tm_remove_layer.

title: Wrapper functions for using tmap in shiny — renderTmap
code: renderTmap(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)  tmapOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = 400)  tmapProxy(mapId, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain(), x)  tm_remove_layer(zindex)

title: Wrapper functions for using tmap in shiny — renderTmap
text: expr tmap object. tmap object created qtm stacking tmap-elements. env environment evaluate expr quoted expr quoted expression (quote())? useful want save expression variable outputId Output variable read width, height width height map mapId single-element character vector indicating output ID map modify (invoked Shiny module, namespace added automatically) session Shiny session object map belongs; usually default value suffice x tmap object specifies added removed layers. zindex z index pane layer contained going removed. recommended specify zindex layer creating map (inside renderTmap).

title: Wrapper functions for using tmap in shiny — renderTmap
text: Two features tmap (yet) supported Shiny: small multiples (facets) colored backgrounds (argument bg.color tm_layout). Workarounds small multiples: create multiple independent maps specify .layers = TRUE tm_facets.

title: Wrapper functions for using tmap in shiny — renderTmap
code: if (require("shiny")) {         data(World)   world_vars <- setdiff(names(World), c("iso_a3", "name", "sovereignt", "geometry"))         ui <- fluidPage(     tmapOutput("map"),     selectInput("var", "Variable", world_vars)   )      server <- function(input, output, session) {     output$map <- renderTmap({       tm_shape(World) +         tm_polygons(world_vars[1], zindex = 401)     })          observe({       var <- input$var       tmapProxy("map", session, {         tm_remove_layer(401) +         tm_shape(World) +           tm_polygons(var, zindex = 401)       })     })   }           app <- shinyApp(ui, server)   if (interactive()) app } #> Loading required package: shiny

title: Add manual legend — tm_add_legend
code: tm_add_legend(   type = c("fill", "symbol", "text", "line", "title"),   labels = NULL,   col = NULL,   size = NULL,   shape = NULL,   lwd = NULL,   lty = NULL,   text = NULL,   alpha = NA,   border.col = "black",   border.lwd = 1,   border.alpha = NA,   title = "",   is.portrait = TRUE,   legend.format = list(),   reverse = FALSE,   z = NA,   zindex = NA,   group = NULL )

title: Add manual legend — tm_add_legend
text: type type legend. One "fill", "symbol", "text", "line", "title". last option displays title. labels legend labels col legend colors size legend symbol sizes (type=="symbol"). See example replicate sizes symbols created tm_symbols. specified, symbols size calling tm_symbols without specifying size argument. shape legend symbol shapes (type=="symbol") lwd legend line widths (type=="line") lty legend line types (type=="line") text legend texts (type=="text") alpha legend fill transparency border.col legend border col (type "fill" "symbol") border.lwd legend border width (type "fill" "symbol") border.alpha legend border alpha (type "fill" "symbol") title legend title .portrait legend portrait (TRUE) landscape (FALSE)? legend.format options format legend, see tm_symbols (description argument legend.format) details. Note many arguments applicable tm_add_legend since labels character vector. However, options still handy, e.g. list(text.align = "right"). reverse legend items reversed (default FALSE)? z legend stack position zindex zindex pane view mode legend belongs (). group name group layer belongs view mode. group can selected deselected layer control item. default NULL, means legend shown layer control item.

title: Add manual legend — tm_add_legend
code: # This example adds a manual legend that combines the tm_symbols color and size legend. if (FALSE) { data(World) data(metro)  # legend bubble size (10, 20, 30, 40 million) are # - are normlized by upper limit (40e6), # - square rooted (see argument perceptual of tm_symbols), and  # - scaled by 2: bubble_sizes <- ((c(10, 20, 30, 40) * 1e6) / 40e6) ^ 0.5 * 2   tm_shape(World) +    tm_polygons() +  tm_shape(metro) +   tm_symbols(col='pop2020',      breaks = c(0, 15, 25, 35, 40) * 1e6,     n=4,     palette = 'YlOrRd',     size='pop2020',     sizes.legend = c(10, 20, 30, 40) * 1e6,     size.lim = c(0, 40e6),     scale = 2,     legend.size.show = FALSE,    # comment this line to see the original size legend     legend.col.show = FALSE,     # comment this line to see the original color legend     legend.size.is.portrait = TRUE) +  tm_add_legend('symbol',    col = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(4, "YlOrRd"),   border.col = "grey40",   size = bubble_sizes,   labels = c('0-15 mln','15-25 mln','25-35 mln','35-40 mln'),   title="Population Estimate") }  # See also the documentation of tm_symbols for another example

title: Map compass — tm_compass
text: Creates map compass.

title: Map compass — tm_compass
code: tm_compass(   north = 0,   type = NA,   text.size = 0.8,   size = NA,   show.labels = 1,   cardinal.directions = c("N", "E", "S", "W"),   text.color = NA,   color.dark = NA,   color.light = NA,   lwd = 1,   position = NA,   bg.color = NA,   bg.alpha = NA,   just = NA,   fontsize = NULL )

title: Map compass — tm_compass
text: north north direction degrees: 0 means , 90 right, etc. type compass type, one : "arrow", "4star", "8star", "radar", "rose". default controlled tm_layout (uses "arrow" default style) text.size relative font size size size compass number text lines. default values depend type: "arrow" 2, "4star" "8star" 4, "radar" "rose" 6. show.labels number specifies labels shown: 0 means labels, 1 (default) means north, 2 means four cardinal directions, 3 means four cardinal directions four intercardinal directions (e.g. north-east). cardinal.directions labels used cardinal directions north, east, south, west. text.color color text. default equal argument attr.color tm_layout. color.dark color dark parts compass, typically (default) black. color.light color light parts compass, typically (default) white. lwd line width compass position position compass. Vector two values, specifying x y coordinates. Either vector contains "left", "LEFT", "center", "right", "RIGHT" first value "top", "TOP", "center", "bottom", "BOTTOM" second value, vector contains two numeric values 0 1 specifies x y value left bottom corner compass. uppercase values correspond position without margins (tighter frame). default value controlled argument "attr.position" tm_layout. bg.color Background color bg.alpha Transparency background color. Number 0 (totally transparent) 1 (transparent). default, alpha value bg.color used (normally 1). just Justification attribute relative point coordinates.  first value specifies horizontal second value vertical justification. Possible values : "left" , "right", "center", "bottom", "top". Numeric values 0 specify left/bottom alignment 1 right/top alignment. option used, position specified numeric coordinates. default value controlled argument "attr.just" tm_layout. fontsize deprecated: renamed text.size

title: Map compass — tm_compass
code: current.mode <- tmap_mode("plot") #> tmap mode set to plotting  data(NLD_muni)  qtm(NLD_muni, theme = "NLD") + tm_compass() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs()  qtm(NLD_muni, theme = "NLD") + tm_compass(type="radar", position=c("left", "top"), show.labels = 3) #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs()   # restore current mode tmap_mode(current.mode) #> tmap mode set to plotting

title: Credits text — tm_credits
text: text text. Multiple lines can created line break symbol "\n". Facets can different texts: case vector characters required. Use "" omit credits specific facets. size relative text size col color text. default equal argument attr.color tm_layout. alpha transparency number 0 (totally transparent) 1 (transparent). default, alpha value col used (normally 1). align horizontal alignment: "left" (default), "center", "right". applicable text contains multiple lines bg.color background color text bg.alpha Transparency number 0 (totally transparent) 1 (transparent). default, alpha value bg.color used (normally 1). fontface font face text. default, determined fontface argument tm_layout. fontfamily font family text. default, determined fontfamily argument tm_layout. position position text. Vector two values, specifying x y coordinates. Either vector contains "left", "LEFT", "center", "right", "RIGHT" first value "top", "TOP", "center", "bottom", "BOTTOM" second value, vector contains two numeric values 0 1 specifies x y value center text. uppercase values correspond position without margins (tighter frame). default value controlled argument "attr.position" tm_layout. width width credits text box, numeric value relative map area (1 means whole map width). default (NA), determined width text. title: Layout of cartographic maps — tm_layout
text: element specifies map layout. main function tm_layout controls title, margins, aspect ratio, colors, frame, legend, among many things. function tm_legend shortcut access legend. arguments without prefix. functions wrappers two purposes: tm_format specifies position related layout settings margins, tm_style specifies general styling related layout settings colors font. Typically, former functions shape dependent, latter functions shape independent. See details predefined styles formats. tmap.style, default style can specified. Multiple tm_layout elements (wrapper functions) can stacked: called arguments overwritten.

title: Layout of cartographic maps — tm_layout
text: title Global title map. small multiples, multiple titles can specified. title drawn inside map. Alternatively, use panel.labels print map panel, title inside panel header (especially useful small multiples). Another alternative main.title prints title map. Titles legend items specified layer functions (e.g. tm_fill). scale numeric value serves global scale parameter. font sizes, symbol sizes, border widths, line widths controlled value. elements can scaled independently scale, lwd, size arguments provided tmap-elements. title.size Relative size title bg.color Background color. default "white". recommended alternative choropleths light grey (e.g., "grey85"). aes.color Default color values aesthetics layers. named vector names chosen : fill, borders, symbols, dots, lines, text, na. Use "#00000000" transparency. aes.palette Default color palettes aesthetics. takes list three items: seq sequential palettes, div diverging palettes, cat categorical palettes. default, Color Brewer palettes (see tmaptools::palette_explorer()) used. also possible provide vector colors items. attr.color Default color value map attributes sepia.intensity Number 0 1 defines amount sepia effect, gives map brown/yellowish flavour. default effect disabled (sepia.intensity=0). colored used map adjusted effect. saturation Number determines much saturation (also known chroma) used: saturation=0 greyscale saturation=1 normal. number larger 1 results saturated maps. colored used map adjusted effect. Hacking tip: use negative number. frame Either boolean determines whether frame drawn, color value specifies color frame. frame.lwd width frame frame.double.line draw double frame line border? asp Aspect ratio. aspect ratio map (width/height). NA, determined bounding box (see argument bbox tm_shape), outer.margins, inner.margins. 0, aspect ratio adjusted aspect ratio device. outer.margins Relative margins device frame. Vector four values specifying bottom, left, top, right margin. Values 0 1. facets created, outer margins margins outer panels device borders (see also .margin) inner.margins Relative margins inside frame. Vector four values specifying bottom, left, top, right margin. Values 0 1. default, 0 side master shape raster, otherwise 0.02. .margin Margin facets (small multiples) number text line heights. height text line automatically scaled based number facets. outer.bg.color Background color outside frame. fontface global font face text map. can also set locally per element (see e.g. title.fontface). fontfamily global font family text map. can also set locally per  (see e.g. title.fontfamily). compass.type type compass, one : "arrow", "4star", "8star", "radar", "rose". course, applicable compass shown. compass type can also set within tm_compass. earth.boundary Logical determines whether boundaries earth shown bounding box specifies boundaries (sf bbox object, see st_bbox, object can read bb). default, boundaries c(-180, -90, 180, 90). Useful projected world maps. Often, useful crop poles (e.g., c(-180, -88, 180, 88)). earth.boundary.color Color earth boundary. earth.boundary.lwd Line width earth boundary. earth.datum Geodetic datum determine earth boundary. default epsg 4326 (long/lat). space.color Color space, .e. region inside frame, outside earth boundary. legend.show Logical determines whether legend shown. legend.logical. draw legend (without map)? Particularly useful small multiples common legend. legend.outside Logical determines whether legend plot outside map/facets. Especially useful using facets common legend (.e. free.scales=FALSE). legend.outside.position Character determines outside position legend. applicable legend.outside=TRUE. One : "right", "left", "top", "bottom". legend.outside.size Numeric value determines relative size legend, legend.outside=TRUE. first value legend.outside.position "top" "bottom", width legend, else height legend. Note actual height width legend determined content legend (used font sizes). argument specifies upperbound width height. legend.position Position legend. Vector two values, specifying x y coordinates. Either vector contains "left", "LEFT", "center", "right", "RIGHT" first value "top", "TOP", "center", "bottom", "BOTTOM" second value, vector contains two numeric values 0 1 specifies x y coordinates left bottom corner legend. uppercase values correspond position without margins (tighter frame). default, automatically placed corner space based (first) shape object. legend.outside=TRUE, argument specifies legend position within outside panel. legend.stack Value determines different legends stacked: "vertical" "horizontal". stack items within legend, look "legend..portrait" specific layer calls. legend.just Justification legend relative point coordinates.  first value specifies horizontal second value vertical justification. Possible values : "left" , "right", "center", "bottom", "top". Numeric values 0 specify left/bottom alignment 1 right/top alignment. option used, legend.position specified numeric coordinates. legend.width width legend. number relative map area (1 means whole map width). negative number, exact legend width. positive number (default), maximum legend width; actual legend width decreased automatically based legend content font sizes.Default color value map attributes legend.height height legend. negative number, exact legend height. positive number (default), maximum legend height; actual legend height decreased automatically based legend content font sizes. legend.hist.height height histogram. height initial. total legend downscaled legend.height, histogram downscaled well. legend.hist.width width histogram. default, equal legend.width. legend.title.color color legend titles legend.title.size Relative font size legend title legend.title.fontface font face legend title. default, set global parameter fontface. legend.title.fontfamily font family legend title. default, set global parameter fontfamily. legend.text.color color legend text legend.text.size Relative font size legend text elements legend.text.fontface font face legend text labels. default, set global parameter fontface. legend.text.fontfamily font family legend text labels. default, set global parameter fontfamily. legend.hist.size Relative font size choropleth histogram legend.format list formatting options legend numbers. applicable layer functions (tm_fill) labels undefined. Otherwise, format="f", text.separator, text.less., text.., big.num.abbr used. code: data(World, land)  tm_shape(World) +      tm_fill("pop_est_dens", style="kmeans", title="Population density") + tm_style("albatross", frame.lwd=10) + tm_format("World", title="The World")   if (FALSE) { tm_shape(land) +   tm_raster("elevation", breaks=c(-Inf, 250, 500, 1000, 1500, 2000, 2500, 3000, 4000, Inf),       palette = terrain.colors(9), title="Elevation", midpoint = NA) + tm_shape(World, is.master=TRUE, projection = "+proj=eck4") +   tm_borders("grey20") +   tm_graticules(labels.size = .5) +   tm_text("name", size="AREA") + tm_compass(position = c(.65, .15), color.light = "grey90") + tm_credits("Eckert IV projection", position = c("right", "BOTTOM")) + tm_style("classic") + tm_layout(bg.color="lightblue",   inner.margins=c(.04,.03, .02, .01),    earth.boundary = TRUE,    space.color="grey90") + tm_legend(position = c("left", "bottom"),    frame = TRUE,   bg.color="lightblue") }    tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=robin") +   tm_polygons("HPI", palette="div", n=7,        title = "Happy Planet Index") + tm_credits("Robinson projection", position = c("right", "BOTTOM")) + tm_style("natural", earth.boundary = c(-180, -87, 180, 87), inner.margins = .05) + tm_legend(position=c("left", "bottom"), bg.color="grey95", frame=TRUE)   # Example to illustrate the type of titles tm_shape(World) +   tm_polygons(c("income_grp", "economy"), title = c("Legend Title 1", "Legend Title 2")) +   tm_layout(main.title = "Main Title",     main.title.position = "center",     main.title.color = "blue",     title = c("Title 1", "Title 2"),     title.color = "red",     panel.labels = c("Panel Label 1", "Panel Label 2"),     panel.label.color = "purple",     legend.text.color = "brown")   if (FALSE) { # global option tmap.style demo    # get current style current.style <- tmap_style()     qtm(World, fill = "economy", format = "World")  tmap_style("col_blind") qtm(World, fill = "economy", format = "World")  tmap_style("cobalt") qtm(World, fill = "economy", format = "World")  # set to current style tmap_style(current.style) }  # TIP: check out these examples in view mode, enabled with tmap_mode("view")

code: data(World)  # Constant fill tm_shape(World) + tm_fill("darkolivegreen3") + tm_format("World", title="A green World")   # Borders only tm_shape(World) + tm_borders()   # Data variable containing colours values World$isNLD <- ifelse(World$name=="Netherlands", "darkorange", "darkolivegreen3") tm_shape(World) +     tm_fill("isNLD") + tm_layout("Find the Netherlands!")   tm_shape(World, projection = "+proj=eck4") +   tm_polygons("economy", title="Economy", id="name") +   tm_text("iso_a3", size="AREA", scale=1.5) +   tm_format("World")   # Numeric data variable tm_shape(World, projection = "+proj=eck4") +   tm_polygons("HPI", palette="RdYlGn", style="cont", n=8,     title="Happy Planet Index", id="name") +   tm_text("iso_a3", size="AREA", scale=1.5) + tm_style("grey") + tm_format("World")   if (FALSE) { data(NLD_prov, NLD_muni)   # Map coloring algorithm tm_shape(NLD_prov) +     tm_fill("name", legend.show = FALSE) + tm_shape(NLD_muni) +     tm_polygons("MAP_COLORS", palette="Greys", alpha = .25) + tm_shape(NLD_prov) +     tm_borders(lwd=2) +     tm_text("name", shadow=TRUE) + tm_format("NLD", title="Dutch provinces and\nmunicipalities", bg.color="white")  # Cartogram if (require(cartogram)) {   NLD_prov_pop <- cartogram(NLD_prov, "population")   tm_shape(NLD_prov_pop) +     tm_polygons("origin_non_west", title = "Non-western origin (%)") } }  # TIP: check out these examples in view mode, enabled with tmap_mode("view")

title: Draw a raster — tm_raster
text: Creates tmap-element draws raster. coloring, three options: 1) fixed color used, 2) color palette mapped data variable, 3) RGB values used. function tm_raster designed options 1 2, tm_rgb used option 3.

title: Draw a raster — tm_raster
code: tm_raster(   col = NA,   alpha = NA,   palette = NULL,   n = 5,   style = ifelse(is.null(breaks), "pretty", "fixed"),   style.args = list(),   as.count = NA,   breaks = NULL,   interval.closure = "left",   labels = NULL,   drop.levels = FALSE,   midpoint = NULL,   stretch.palette = TRUE,   contrast = NA,   saturation = 1,   interpolate = NA,   colorNA = NULL,   textNA = "Missing",   showNA = NA,   colorNULL = NULL,   title = NA,   legend.show = TRUE,   legend.format = list(),   legend.is.portrait = TRUE,   legend.reverse = FALSE,   legend.hist = FALSE,   legend.hist.title = NA,   legend.z = NA,   legend.hist.z = NA,   zindex = NA,   group = NA,   auto.palette.mapping = NULL,   max.categories = NULL,   max.value = 255 )  tm_rgb(   r = 1,   g = 2,   b = 3,   alpha = NA,   saturation = 1,   interpolate = TRUE,   max.value = 255,   ... )  tm_rgba(   r = 1,   g = 2,   b = 3,   a = 4,   alpha = NA,   saturation = 1,   interpolate = TRUE,   max.value = 255,   ... )

title: Draw a raster — tm_raster
text: Tennekes, M., 2018, tmap: Thematic Maps R, Journal Statistical Software, 84(6), 1-39, doi:10.18637/jss.v084.i06

title: Draw a raster — tm_raster
code: data(World, land, metro)  pal8 <- c("#33A02C", "#B2DF8A", "#FDBF6F", "#1F78B4", "#999999", "#E31A1C", "#E6E6E6", "#A6CEE3") tm_shape(land, ylim = c(-88,88)) +     tm_raster("cover_cls", palette = pal8, title = "Global Land Cover") + tm_shape(metro) + tm_dots(col = "#E31A1C") + tm_shape(World) +     tm_borders(col = "black") + tm_layout(scale = .8,    legend.position = c("left","bottom"),     legend.bg.color = "white", legend.bg.alpha = .2,      legend.frame = "gray50") #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs()   if (FALSE) { pal20 <- c("#003200", "#3C9600", "#006E00", "#556E19", "#00C800", "#8CBE8C",        "#467864", "#B4E664", "#9BC832", "#EBFF64", "#F06432", "#9132E6",        "#E664E6", "#9B82E6", "#B4FEF0", "#646464", "#C8C8C8", "#FF0000",        "#FFFFFF", "#5ADCDC") tm_shape(land) +   tm_raster("cover", palette = pal20, title = "Global Land Cover") +    tm_layout(scale=.8, legend.position = c("left","bottom")) }   tm_shape(land, ylim = c(-88,88)) +     tm_raster("trees", palette = "Greens", title = "Percent Tree Cover") + tm_shape(World) +     tm_borders() + tm_layout(legend.position = c("left", "bottom"), bg.color = "lightblue")   if (FALSE) { tm_shape(land) +   tm_raster("black") +   tm_facets(by="cover_cls") }  # TIP: check out these examples in view mode, enabled with tmap_mode("view")

title: Scale bar — tm_scale_bar
text: Creates scale bar. default, coordinate units assumed meters, map units kilometers. can changed tm_shape.

title: Scale bar — tm_scale_bar
code: tm_scale_bar(   breaks = NULL,   width = NA,   text.size = 0.5,   text.color = NA,   color.dark = "black",   color.light = "white",   lwd = 1,   position = NA,   bg.color = NA,   bg.alpha = NA,   just = NA,   size = NULL )

title: Scale bar — tm_scale_bar
text: breaks breaks scale bar. specified, breaks automatically chosen given prefered width scale bar. available view mode. width (preferred) width scale bar. applicable breaks=NULL. plot mode, corresponds relative width; default 0.25 one fourth map width. view mode, corresponds width pixels; default 100. text.size relative text size (upperbound available label width) text.color color text. default equal argument attr.color tm_layout. color.dark color dark parts scale bar, typically (default) black. color.light color light parts scale bar, typically (default) white. lwd line width scale bar position position scale bar Vector two values, specifying x y coordinates. Either vector contains "left", "LEFT", "center", "right", "RIGHT" first value "top", "TOP", "center", "bottom", "BOTTOM" second value, vector contains two numeric values 0 1 specifies x y value left bottom corner scale bar. uppercase values correspond position without margins (tighter frame). default value controlled argument "attr.position" tm_layout. bg.color Background color bg.alpha Transparency background color. Number 0 (totally transparent) 1 (transparent). default, alpha value bg.color used (normally 1). just Justification attribute relative point coordinates.  first value specifies horizontal second value vertical justification. Possible values : "left" , "right", "center", "bottom", "top". Numeric values 0 specify left/bottom alignment 1 right/top alignment. option used, position specified numeric coordinates. default value controlled argument "attr.just" tm_layout. size deprecated: renamed text.size

title: Scale bar — tm_scale_bar

code: data(World)  World$geometry[World$continent == "Africa"] <-    sf::st_centroid(World$geometry[World$continent == "Africa"]) World$geometry[World$continent == "South America"] <-    sf::st_cast(World$geometry[World$continent == "South America"],      "MULTILINESTRING", group_or_split = FALSE)  tm_shape(World) +    tm_sf()

title: Specify the shape object — tm_shape
text: Creates tmap-element specifies spatial data object, refer shape. Also projection covered area (bounding box) can set. possible use multiple shape objects within one plot (see tmap-element).

title: Specify the shape object — tm_shape
code: tm_shape(   shp,   name = NULL,   is.master = NA,   projection = NULL,   bbox = NULL,   unit = NULL,   simplify = 1,   point.per = NA,   line.center = "midpoint",   filter = NULL,   raster.downsample = TRUE,   raster.warp = TRUE,   ... )

title: Specify the shape object — tm_shape
text: shp shape object, object class defined sf stars package. Objects packages sp raster also supported, discouraged. name name shape object (character) appears legend "view" mode. Default value name shp. .master logical determines whether tm_shape master shape element. bounding box, projection settings, unit specifications resulting thematic map taken tm_shape element master shape object. default, first master shape element raster shape master, raster shapes used, first tm_shape master shape element. projection Map projection (CRS). Either crs object character value (PROJ.4 character string). default, projection used defined shp object . bbox bounding box. One following: bounding box (sf bbox object, see st_bbox, object can read bb. Open Street Map search query. bounding automatically generated querying q Open Street Map Nominatim. See https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim. Another shape object, bounding box extracted. unspecified, current bounding box shp taken. bounding box feed bb (argument x. arguments bb can specified directly well (see ..). unit desired units map. One "metric" (default), "imperial", "km", "m", "mi" "ft". Used specify scale bar (see tm_scale_bar) calculate densities choropleths (see argument convert2density tm_fill). simplify simplification factor spatial polygons spatial lines. number 0 1 indicates many coordinates kept. See underlying function simplify_shape, arguments keep.units keep.subunits can passed (see ...). requires suggested package rmapshaper. point.per specification points text labels plotted geometry multi line multi polygon. One "feature", "segment" "largest". first generates point/label every feature, second every segment (.e. subfeature), third largest segment (subfeature). Note last two options can significant slower. default, set "segment" geometry shp (multi)points geometry geometrycollection, "feature" otherwise. line.center specification points placed (multi)line geometries. Either "midpoint" "centroid". former places point middle line, latter controid. filter logical vector indicated per feature whether included. Features filter FALSE colored light gray (see colorNULL argument layer functions) raster.downsample raster shape (.e. stars object) downsampled loo large? large determined tmap option max.raster (see tmap_options). downsampled, downsampled approximately max.raster cells. message shown exact size. raster.warp raster shape (.e. stars object) warped map shown different map projection (CRS)? TRUE (default) raster warped regular grid new projection. Otherwise, raster shape transformed original raster cells kept intact. Warping raster much faster transforming. Note raster shape projection 4326 warped transformed view mode. ... Arguments passed bb (e.g. ext can used enlarge shrinke bounding box), simplify_shape (arguments keep.units keep.subunits)

title: Specify the shape object — tm_shape
code: current.mode <- tmap_mode("plot") #> tmap mode set to plotting  data(World, metro, rivers)  tm_shape(World) +      tm_polygons() +  tm_layout("Long lat coordinates (WGS84)", inner.margins=c(0,0,.1,0), title.size=.8)   World$highlighted <- ifelse(World$iso_a3 %in% c("GRL", "AUS"), "gold", "gray75") tm_shape(World, projection=3857, ylim=c(.1, 1), relative = TRUE) +      tm_polygons("highlighted") +  tm_layout("Web Mercator projection. Although widely used, it is discouraged for statistical purposes. In reality, Australia is 3 times larger than Greenland!",     inner.margins=c(0,0,.1,0), title.size=.6)   tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=robin") +      tm_polygons() + tm_layout( "Winkel-Tripel projection, adapted as default by the National Geographic Society for world maps.",     inner.margins=c(0,0,.1,0), title.size=.8)   tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=eck4") +     tm_polygons() +  tm_layout("Eckhart IV projection. Recommended in statistical maps for its equal-area property.",     inner.margins=c(0,0,.1,0), title.size=.8)    # different levels of simplification if (FALSE) { tm1 <- tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=eck4", simplify = 0.05) + tm_polygons() +      tm_layout("Simplification: 0.05") tm2 <- tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=eck4", simplify = 0.1) + tm_polygons() +      tm_layout("Simplification: 0.1") tm3 <- tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=eck4", simplify = 0.25) + tm_polygons() +      tm_layout("Simplification: 0.25") tm4 <- tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=eck4", simplify = 0.5) + tm_polygons() +      tm_layout("Simplification: 0.5")  require(tmaptools) tmap_arrange(tm1, tm2, tm3, tm4) }  # three groups of layers, each starting with tm_shape if (FALSE) { tm_shape(World, projection="+proj=eck4") +     tm_fill("darkolivegreen3") + tm_shape(metro) +     tm_bubbles("pop2010", col = "grey30", scale=.5) + tm_shape(rivers) +     tm_lines("lightcyan1") + tm_layout(bg.color="lightcyan1", inner.margins=c(0,0,.02,0), legend.show = FALSE) }  # restore current mode tmap_mode(current.mode) #> tmap mode set to plotting

title: Draw symbols — tm_symbols
code: data(World, metro) metro$growth <- (metro$pop2020 - metro$pop2010) / (metro$pop2010 * 10) * 100  tm_shape(World) +     tm_fill("grey70") + tm_shape(metro) +     tm_bubbles("pop2010", col = "growth",          border.col = "black", border.alpha = .5,          style="fixed", breaks=c(-Inf, seq(0, 6, by=2), Inf),         palette="-RdYlBu", contrast=1,          title.size="Metro population",          title.col="Growth rate (%)") +  tm_format("World") #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> Variable(s) "growth" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.   tm_shape(metro) +   tm_symbols(size = "pop2010", col="pop2010", shape="pop2010",     legend.format = list(text.align="right", text.to.columns = TRUE)) + tm_legend(outside = TRUE, outside.position = "bottom", stack = "horizontal") #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs()    if (require(ggplot2) && require(dplyr) && require(tidyr) && require(tmaptools) && require(sf)) { data(NLD_prov)  origin_data <- NLD_prov %>%    st_set_geometry(NULL) %>%  mutate(FID= factor(1:n())) %>%  select(FID, origin_native, origin_west, origin_non_west) %>%  gather(key=origin, value=perc, origin_native, origin_west, origin_non_west, factor_key=TRUE)  origin_cols <- get_brewer_pal("Dark2", 3)  grobs <- lapply(split(origin_data, origin_data$FID), function(x) { ggplotGrob(ggplot(x, aes(x="", y=-perc, fill=origin)) +   geom_bar(width=1, stat="identity") +   scale_y_continuous(expand=c(0,0)) +   scale_fill_manual(values=origin_cols) +   theme_ps(plot.axes = FALSE)) })  names(grobs) <- NLD_prov$name  tm_shape(NLD_prov) + tm_polygons(group = "Provinces") + tm_symbols(size="population", shape="name",    shapes=grobs,    sizes.legend=c(.5, 1,3)*1e6,    scale=1,    legend.shape.show = FALSE,    legend.size.is.portrait = TRUE,    shapes.legend = 22,    title.size = "Population",   group = "Charts",   id = "name",   popup.vars = c("population", "origin_native",            "origin_west", "origin_non_west")) + tm_add_legend(type="fill",    group = "Charts",   col=origin_cols,    labels=c("Native", "Western", "Non-western"),    title="Origin") + tm_format("NLD") } #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Loading required package: tmaptools #> Loading required package: sf #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE  #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs()     # TIP: check out these examples in view mode, enabled with tmap_mode("view")  if (FALSE) { if (require(rnaturalearth)) {  airports <- ne_download(scale=10, type="airports", returnclass = "sf") airplane <- tmap_icons(system.file("img/airplane.png", package = "tmap"))  current.mode <- tmap_mode("view") tm_shape(airports) +   tm_symbols(shape=airplane, size="natlscale",         legend.size.show = FALSE, scale=1, border.col = NULL, id="name", popup.vars = TRUE) + tm_view(set.view = c(lon = 15, lat = 48, zoom = 4)) tmap_mode(current.mode) } }  #####################################################################################  if (FALSE) { # plot all available symbol shapes: if (require(ggplot2)) {   ggplot(data.frame(p=c(0:25,32:127))) +   geom_point(aes(x=p%%16, y=-(p%/%16), shape=p), size=5, fill="red") +   geom_text(mapping=aes(x=p%%16, y=-(p%/%16+0.25), label=p), size=3) +   scale_shape_identity() +   theme(axis.title=element_blank(),       axis.text=element_blank(),       axis.ticks=element_blank(),       panel.background=element_blank()) } }

code: current.mode <- tmap_mode("plot") #> tmap mode set to plotting  data(World, metro)  tm_shape(World) +     tm_text("name", size="AREA")   tm_shape(World) +   tm_text("name", size="pop_est", col="continent", palette="Dark2",       title.size = "Population", title.col="Continent") +   tm_legend(outside = TRUE)   tmap_mode("view") #> tmap mode set to interactive viewing  if (FALSE) { require(tmaptools) metro_aus <- crop_shape(metro, bb("Australia"))  tm_shape(metro_aus) +   tm_dots() +   tm_text("name", just = "top")  # alternative tm_shape(metro_aus) +   tm_markers(text = "name") }  # restore current mode tmap_mode(current.mode) #> tmap mode set to plotting

title: Draw a tile layer — tm_basemap
text: Creates tmap-element draws tile layer. feature available view mode. plot mode, tile image can retrieved read_osm. function tm_basemap draws tile layer basemap (.e. bottom layer), whereas tm_tiles draws tile layer overlay layer (stacking order corresponds order layer called). Note basemaps shown default (see details).

title: Draw a tile layer — tm_basemap
code: tm_basemap(server = NA, group = NA, alpha = NA, tms = FALSE)  tm_tiles(server, group = NA, alpha = 1, zindex = NA, tms = FALSE)

title: Draw a tile layer — tm_basemap
text: server name provider URL. list available providers can obtained providers (tip: RStudio, type providers$ see options). See https://leaflet-extras.github.io/leaflet-providers/preview/ preview . URL provided, template format, e.g. "https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png". Use NULL tm_basemap disable basemaps. group name group layer belongs view mode. group can selected deselected layer control item. Set group = NULL hide layer layer control item. default, set name shape (specified tm_shape). Tile layers generated tm_basemap base groups whereas tile layers generated tm_tiles overlay groups. alpha alpha tms provided tile server defined according TMS protocol? default FALSE. zindex zindex pane view mode. default, set layer number plus 400. default, tmap layers therefore placed custom panes "tmap401", "tmap402", etc., except base tile layers, placed standard "tile". parameter determines name pane z-index, determines pane order bottom top. instance, zindex set 500, pane named "tmap500".

Similarly, tm_tiles specified, overlay maps specified overlays argument tmap_options shown front layer. default, argument set NULL, overlay maps shown default. See examples.

title: Draw a tile layer — tm_basemap
code: if (FALSE) { current.mode <- tmap_mode("view")  data(World, metro)  tm_basemap(leaflet::providers$Stamen.Watercolor) + tm_shape(metro, bbox = "India") + tm_dots(col = "red", group = "Metropolitan areas") + tm_tiles(paste0("http://services.arcgisonline.com/arcgis/rest/services/Canvas/",     "World_Light_Gray_Reference/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}"), group = "Labels")   # Use tmap options to set the basemap and overlay map permanently during the R session: opts <- tmap_options(basemaps = c(Canvas = "Esri.WorldGrayCanvas", Imagery = "Esri.WorldImagery"),     overlays = c(Labels = paste0("http://services.arcgisonline.com/arcgis/rest/services/Canvas/",                                  "World_Light_Gray_Reference/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}")))      qtm(World, fill = "HPI", fill.palette = "RdYlGn")  # restore options tmap_options(opts)  # restore current mode tmap_mode(current.mode) }

code: tm_view(   alpha,   colorNA,   projection,   symbol.size.fixed,   dot.size.fixed,   text.size.variable,   bbox,   set.bounds,   set.view,   set.zoom.limits,   view.legend.position,   control.position,   legend.position,   leaflet.options )

title: Options for the interactive tmap viewer — tm_view
text: alpha transparency (opacity) parameter applied whole map. default, set 0.7 basemaps used, 1 otherwise. colorNA default color missing values interactive mode. color missing values defined layer functions (e.g. tm_fill), default color taken na value aes.color argument tm_layout. colorNA argument (NA ) overrides default value. interactive maps, can useful set colorNA NULL, means transparent. projection projection. Either EPSG number, leaflet_crs object created leafletCRS. default, Web Mercator (3857) used, since vast majority basemaps rendered accordingly. standards EPSG numbers 4326 (WGS84) 3395 (Mercator). set 0, projection master shape used (see tm_shape) provided EPSG number can extracted. symbol.size.fixed symbol sizes fixed zooming? dot.size.fixed dot sizes fixed zooming? text.size.variable text size variables allowed view mode? default FALSE, since many applications, main reason vary text size prevent occlusion plot mode, often problem view mode due ability zoom . bbox bounding box. One following: bounding box (sf bbox object, see st_bbox, object can read bb. Open Street Map search query. bounding automatically generated querying q Open Street Map Nominatim. See https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Nominatim. set, overrides set.view bbox arguments tm_shape. set.bounds logical determines whether maximum bounds set, numeric vector four values specify lng1, lat1, lng2, lat2 coordinates (see setMaxBounds). set.view numeric vector determines view. Either vector three: lng, lat, zoom, single value: zoom. See setView. applicable bbox specified set.zoom.limits numeric vector two set minimum maximum zoom levels (see tileOptions). view.legend.position Character vector two values, specifying position legend. Use "left" "right" first value "top" "bottom" second value. overrides value legend.position tm_layout, unless set NA. control.position Character vector two values, specifying position layer control UI. Use "left" "right" first value "top" "bottom" second value. legend.position used anymore, renamed view.legend.position leaflet.options options passed via leafletOptions leaflet.js map creation (see leaflet, follow Docs, Map, Creation). Named list, names correspond variable names. Tip: use zoomSnap zoomDelta fractional zooming.

title: Create animation — tmap_animation
code: if (FALSE) { data(NLD_prov)  m1 <- tm_shape(NLD_prov) +          tm_polygons("yellow") +     tm_facets(along = "name")  tmap_animation(m1, delay=40)  data(World, metro)  m2 <- tm_shape(World, projection = "+proj=eck4", simplify = 0.5) +           tm_fill() +       tm_shape(metro) +            tm_bubbles(size = paste0("pop", seq(1970, 2030, by=10)),                  col = "purple",                  border.col = "black", border.alpha = .5,                  scale = 2) +       tm_facets(free.scales.symbol.size = FALSE, nrow=1,ncol=1) +        tm_format("World")  tmap_animation(m2, delay=100, outer.margins = 0)  m3 <- lapply(seq(50, 85, by = 5), function(age) {   World$at_most <- World$life_exp <= age   World_sel <- World[which((World$life_exp <= age) & (World$life_exp > (age - 5))), ]   tm_shape(World) +     tm_polygons("at_most", palette = c("gray95", "gold"), legend.show = FALSE) +     tm_shape(World_sel) +     tm_text("name", size = "AREA", root = 5, remove.overlap = TRUE) +     tm_layout(main.title = paste0("Life expectency at most ", age), frame = FALSE) })  tmap_animation(m3, width = 1200, height = 600, delay = 100)  m4 <- tm_shape(World) +   tm_polygons() + tm_shape(metro) +   tm_bubbles(col = "red") +   tm_text("name", ymod = -1) + tm_facets(by = "name", free.coords = F, nrow = 1, ncol = 1) +   tm_layout(panel.show = FALSE, frame = FALSE)  tmap_animation(m4, filename = "World_cities.mp4",      width=1200, height = 600, fps = 2, outer.margins = 0) }

text: Set tmap mode static plotting interactive viewing. global option tmap.mode determines whether thematic maps plot graphics device, shown interactive leaflet map (see also tmap_options. function tmap_mode wrapper set global option. convenient function ttm, stands toggle thematic map, toggle switch two modes. function ttmp stands toggle thematic map print last map: ttm followed tmap_last; order words, shows last map mode. recommended use tmap_mode scripts ttm/ttmp console.

title: Set tmap mode to static plotting or interactive viewing — tmap_mode
text: mode one "plot" Thematic maps shown graphics device. default mode, supports tmap's features, small multiples (see tm_facets) extensive layout settings (see tm_layout). recommended saving static maps (see tmap_save). "view" Thematic maps viewed interactively web browser RStudio's Viewer pane. Maps fully interactive tiles OpenStreetMap map providers (see tm_tiles). See also tm_view options related "view" mode. mode generates leaflet widget, can also directly obtained tmap_leaflet. RMarkdown, possible publish HTML page.         couple constraints comparison "plot": map always projected according Web Mercator projection. Although projection de facto standard interactive web-based mapping, lacks equal-area property, important many thematic maps, especially choropleths (see examples tm_shape). Small multiples supported legend made aesthetics regarding size, symbol size line width. Text labels supported (yet) layout options set tm_layout) regarding map format used. However, styling options still apply.

title: Set tmap mode to static plotting or interactive viewing — tmap_mode

title: Set tmap mode to static plotting or interactive viewing — tmap_mode
code: # world choropleth/bubble map of the world data(World, metro) metro$growth <- (metro$pop2020 - metro$pop2010) / (metro$pop2010 * 10) * 100  map1 <- tm_shape(World) +   tm_polygons("income_grp", palette="-Blues", contrast=.7, id="name", title="Income group") +   tm_shape(metro) +   tm_bubbles("pop2010", col = "growth",      border.col = "black", border.alpha = .5,      style="fixed", breaks=c(-Inf, seq(0, 6, by=2), Inf),     palette="-RdYlBu", contrast=1,      title.size="Metro population",      title.col="Growth rate (%)", id="name",     popup.vars = c("pop2010", "pop2020", "growth")) +    tm_layout(legend.bg.color = "grey90", legend.bg.alpha=.5, legend.frame=TRUE)  # initial mode: "plot" current.mode <- tmap_mode("plot") #> tmap mode set to plotting  # plot map map1 #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> Variable(s) "growth" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.   # switch to other mode: "view" ttm() #> tmap mode set to interactive viewing  # view map map1 #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> old-style crs object detected; please recreate object with a recent sf::st_crs() #> Variable(s) "growth" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette. #> Legend for symbol sizes not available in view mode.  if (FALSE) { # choropleth of the Dutch population in interactive mode: require(tmaptools) data(NLD_muni, NLD_prov) NLD_muni$pop_dens <- calc_densities(NLD_muni, var = "population")  tm_shape(NLD_muni) +   tm_fill(col="pop_dens",      style="kmeans",      title = "Population (per km^2)", id = "name") +   tm_borders("grey25", alpha=.5) +    tm_shape(NLD_prov) +   tm_borders("grey40", lwd=2) }  # restore current mode tmap_mode(current.mode) #> tmap mode set to plotting

title: Options for tmap — tmap_options
text: ... options tm_layout tm_view. Note difference using tm_layout tm_view directly, options set tmap_options remain entire session (unless changed tmap_options tmap_style). can also single unnamed argument named list options (similar behaviour options). unit default value unit argument tm_shape. specifies unit measurement, used scale bar calculation density values. default (loading package), "metric". valid values "imperial", "km", "m", "mi", "ft". limits option determines many facets (small multiples) allowed per mode. vector two numeric values named facets.view facets.plot. default (.e. loading package), set c(facets.view = 4, facets.plot = 64) max.categories case col name categorical variable layer functions (e.g. tm_polygons), value determines many categories (levels) can maximally. number levels higher max.categories, levels combined. max.raster maximum size rasters, terms number raster cells. vector two numeric values named plot view, determines size plotting viewing mode. default values c(plot = 1e7, view = 1e6). Rasters larger shown decreased resolution. basemaps default basemaps. Basemaps normally configured tm_basemap. done, basemaps specified option shown (view mode). Vector one names baselayer maps, NULL basemaps omitted. options see list leaflet::providers, can previewed https://leaflet-extras.github.io/leaflet-providers/preview/. Also supports URL's tile servers, "https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png". named vector provided, names used layer control legend (similar group argument tm_basemap. See also overlays, default option overlay tiles. basemaps.alpha default transparency (opacity) value basemaps. Can vector values, one basemap. overlays default overlay tilemaps. Overlays tilemaps shown front layer (contrast basemaps, background layers), useful semi-transparent. Like basemaps, vector tilemaps expected, NULL overlays omitted. overlays.alpha default transparency (opacity) value overlay maps. Can vector values, one overlay map. qtm.scalebar scale bar added interactive maps created qtm. words, tm_scale_bar() added automatically? value NA means scale bar added qtm called without arguments search term. default value TRUE. qtm.minimap minimap added interactive maps created qtm. words, tm_minimap() added automatically? default value FALSE. qtm.mouse.coordinates mouse coordinates (zoom level) shown view mode qtm? words, tm_mouse_coordinates() added automatically? TRUE default. show.messages messages shown? show.warnings warnings shown? output.format format static maps saved tmap_save without specification filename. default "png". output.size size static maps saved tmap_save without specification width height. unit squared inch default 49. means square maps (aspect ratio 1) saved 7 7 inch images map aspect ratio 2 (e.g. world maps) saved approximately 10 5 inch. output.dpi default number dots per inch tmap_save. output.dpi.animation default number dots per inch tmap_animation. design.mode used anymore; design mode can now set tmap_design_mode check..fix Logical determines whether shapes (sf objects) checked validity st_is_valid fixed st_make_valid needed. style style name

title: Options for tmap — tmap_options
text: options can divided three parts: one part contains arguments tm_layout, one part contains arguments tm_view, one part contains options can set tmap_options. Observe options tm_layout tm_view can also set functions. recommended use tmap_options setting specific options global session. However, options relevant specific map can better set tm_layout tm_view. new style can created two ways. first approach use function tmap_options_save, takes snapshot current tmap options. E.g., tmap_options_save("my_style") save current tmap options style called "my_style". See examples style called "red" created. second way create style create list tmap options attribute called style. approach illustrated last example, style called "black" created. newly created style, say "my_style", accessible globally via tmap_style("my_style") + tm_style("my_style") R session restarted tmap reloaded. order save style future use sharing, obtain option list follows: my_style <- tmap_options() save object my_style usual way. Next time, style can loaded simply running tmap_options(my_style), corresponds second way create style (see paragraph ).

plot the map again tm_shape(World) + tm_polygons("HPI")   ############################## # define red style ##############################  # change the background color tmap_options(bg.color = "red")
